metadata.title: CVE-2015-1462 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
ClamAV before 0.98.6 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact viaa crafted upx packer file, related to a "heap out of bounds condition."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav6 - 0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.98.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
